item.title: Debugging and Profiling Scientific Software
item.description: Summary The first step to writing code is to first get it to work both syntactically and scientifically, and later to make it work fast. This lecture will cover both aspects: first the use of a /debugger/ to identify and fix broken code, and then the use of profiling tools to identify which parts of working code be improved for speed or memory usage. item.title: Unit Testing
item.description: Summary Making sure software works as expected and required is a crucial part of development. Doing this manually is tedious and error prone. In this lecture, you will learn the basics of automated unit testing for python using pytest. Slides as PDF This browser does not support PDFs. Please download the PDF to view it: Download PDF.
